issue.title: DiscoveryClient content seems null
issue.body:
Hi,

I use SNAPSHOT version add when i try to autowired the discoveryClient the content is null, my service is registered to eurekaServer.

I haven't this problem with the milestones (M1) version

```java
@Component
public class EurekaClients {

	@Autowired
	@Lazy
	private DiscoveryClient discoveryClient;

	@Autowired
	private SwaggerConfig swaggerConfig;

	public HashMap<String, String> getAllClients() {
		HashMap<String, String> urlClients = new HashMap<String, String>();
		discoveryClient.getApplications().getRegisteredApplications().forEach(a -> {
			a.getInstances().forEach(i -> {
				urlClients.put(i.getAppName(),
						swaggerConfig.getPath() + i.getHomePageUrl().toString() + swaggerConfig.getPattern());
			});
		});
		return urlClients;
	}

}
```

I have this exception : 

```
org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No qualifying bean of type [com.netflix.discovery.DiscoveryClient] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. comment.body:
```
@dsyer 
List<ServiceInstance> list = client.getInstances(service) returns empty list even though I see the services as running in eureka. I tried using EurekaClient, DiscoveryClient and EurekaDiscoveryClient. But no luck there :( any idea what could be wrong.

organization.description: Tools for building common patterns in distributed systems with Spring
